quest.name: Test World of Ruin
journal: Nero seems unusually anxious to move things along.

Together, Nero and Cid present a profile of your final opponent in the Sigmascape─a magic-using jester by the name of “Kefka.” According to their research, the mage is wont to confound his opponents with subtle feints. Accordingly, Nero has adjusted his monitor to give him an unusually clear view of the battle, and will attempt to warn you of impending deceptions. Speak with Alpha to put Nero's strategy to the test.

※In the event that you leave the Interdimensional Rift, you may re-enter by speaking with the Ironworks hand at the Yawn.

Alpha stands ready to enter the Sigmascape with you. Keep your eyes open and your mind sharp, for it is time to do battle with the illusive Kefka!

※Sigmascape V4.0 can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
You have defeated Kefka, a victory which should signal the end of your struggles within the Sigmascape. It is time to leave and return to the Fringes.

After descending to congratulate you on your triumph, Omega proceeds to deliver its theory on the secret of your inexplicable combat potential. You are, it contends, subconsciously restricting your own performance save when placed in mortal danger. As such, unlocking your “true” capabilities should logically be a matter of threatening you with death... Before you know what is happening, you find yourself trapped in a prism of energy, with scant moments to live. But just when all seems lost, Midgardsormr uses the last of his strength to assume his original form, and intervenes to rescue you from an untimely end. The Father of Dragons then fades into slumber, satisfied that his guidance is no longer required... You are still reeling from your ordeal when Cid arrives, yelling about Nero. But at the sight of you, he bites his tongue, and bids you make a swift exit to the lip of the Yawn.
You return to the outside world to learn that Nero has been transported to Rhalgr's Reach having collapsed. Make your own way back to the settlement, and call on the waiting Jessie.

As you are speaking with Jessie, a weary Cid approaches bearing the news that Nero will be incapacitated for some time. Even as exhaustion and injury begin to take their toll on your companions, it is plain that Omega's trials will only become more dangerous. You have little choice therefore but to take Cid's exhortations to heart, and temper body and mind to withstand whatever monstrous opponents Omega has in store for you next.
objectives: Speak with Jessie in Rhalgr's Reach.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Nero still seems unwell. How much of that coffee did he drink?

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh...

dialogue.name: GARLONDGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorrowday to you, madamsir. Will you be descending into the Yawn?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Enter the Interdimensional Rift?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text:
This is it...
The final battle to conquer the...<cough>...Sigmascape.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...We've put together a profile of your next opponent.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You've encountered some fantastical foes in here, but this time you'll have the novel experience of fighting an actual person. His name is “Kefka”...and he's a jester.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: According to the data, his preferred mode of fooling didn't just bring the house down, but the whole world.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Apparently, he found comedy in the tragedies of others, and condemned countless thousands to death for his own amusement.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Hm hm... That a jester should bring such misery. 'Tis almost amusing.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, we must treat this villain with all seriousness. His rise to godhood and subsequent rule over a shattered world is clearly documented in the records.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Kefka is a formidable mage, and a cunning one besides. Your tactics must account for both his power and his trickery.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You've been working on a solution, yes? Will it be enough?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Will it be enough? Have you ever known me to do anything by halves?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: The jester's face paint is a mask for his intent. If you only watch the surface, you'll be fighting at a disadvantage.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: To put it bluntly, Kefka will seek to deceive you. Even as you predict his actions and adjust your position, his true attack will reveal the feint for what it was.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text:
This is where things become interesting...
I have tuned this monitor to allow me to observe the Sigmascape with greatly enhanced clarity.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: If I observe a discrepancy between Kefka's behavior and the impending attack, I will endeavor to warn you. The timing will be critical, of course.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: How confident are you of this strategy?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: I predict a fifty percent chance of success! Any delay, however slight, in reacting to his feints will render my warnings all but pointless!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Isn't it exciting? There is no safe way to practice this, hero─we must test our tactics on the field of battle!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...I'm afraid he's right. I'll lend you all the support I can from this side.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Make what preparations you need, and head into the Sigmascape. We can't let this jester have the last laugh!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: “Embrace your destruction... It is the fate of all things.”

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: “But people can always rebuild, and new lives will always be born!”

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: ...A fragmented conversation that accompanied Kefka's data. His was the first line, but there was no mention of who uttered the reply.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You admire this villain.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: In life, there is always hope.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: ...Perhaps. I admire the idea of upsetting the status quo.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Go on, champion. I tire of waiting for the fun to begin.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: ...How predictably forthright of you. I'm sure it was a hero much like yourself who gave the original response.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Go on, champion. I tire of waiting for the fun to begin.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: ...Never mind. Go on, champion. I tire of waiting for the fun to begin.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Let's see this through, Forename. One battle at a time!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Are you asking my permission? By all means, let's get things underway.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text:
Kweh!
Kweh, kweh kweh, kweh!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alpha is clearly poised to spring into action. You may enter Sigmascape V4.0 whenever you are ready.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text:
Kweh!
Kweh, kweh kweh, kweh!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...That's it, isn't it? SheHe's won!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)<blip> This contest has been decided. Alpha group is victorious.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)The Sigmascape test world will now be erased.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Come on! We should go and find Forename!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Nero!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Talk to me, man! Are you hurt!?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text:
You could say that...
I had a “visitor” while you were attending your little Ironworks reunion.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text:
Omega...
Damn it! We should never have left you alone. Not after what happened to Biggs and Wedge.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text:
Hmph... As if I would trail along behind you...like some sniveling lapdog...
No, I chose to remain...and behold the results...

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: This was my victory! It was my ingenuity that defeated these foes! Even your precious Warrior of Light...<cough>...was just another variable in my grand experiments!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: All right, Nero, save your strength. I'll fetch Forename and Alpha, and then we can get out of here.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Garlond...

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: ...The next round is yours.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: But you can't keep holding back... It's time to unfetter that brilliant mind of yours. To do what must be done.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: And I'm not just talking about what becomes of Omega.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: You cannot preach “Freedom through Technology” and keep yourself locked up in chains...

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text:
Another battle won...
Thy might knoweth no bounds, child of man.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)<blip> The Sigmascape has been terminated. Congratulations, Alpha group. Congratulations, Forename Surname.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)Consistent with previous performances, you have once more defeated a foe of vastly superior combat capabilities. I have constructed a theory to explain this phenomenon.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)In order to conserve life energy, you subconsciously limit your output during standard activity.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)I have taken this factor into account when calculating your potential, but judging by the wild fluctuation in values, is it possible your limits are exceeded by an unpredictably high degree when engaged in battle?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)<bloop> Current data unreliable. Accuracy of further experiments may be compromised. Recalculations necessary.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)You will exhibit your full potential, unrestricted by self-imposed limits.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)Prediction. Placing subject in mortal peril will facilitate the collection of desired data.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)Reveal your power. Let me measure the extent of your existence.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)In precisely one hundred and eighty seconds, I will terminate your life. You are to attempt escape with every last reserve of strength you possess.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)Alpha. Your participation is unnecessary. Do not interfere.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: ...Curious. 'Twould seem the circumstances of thy birth taint not the purity of thy life. The seed which all mortals nurture is found within thee too, Alpha.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text:
As for thee, Omega...
After the passing of eons, is this truly the extent of thine evolution? I have glimpsed the core of thy wretched existence, and judge that my guidance here is no longer needed...

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Even I cannot fully bend the rules which govern this place. I have reached beyond my strength at the last...

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text:
But so be it.
Such a death becometh thee not!

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: To slumber shall I betake me for a time. The incarnation I leave with thee will be mine in form, but not in spirit.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text:
(-Omega-)Midgardsormr...
Again, your actions are incomprehensible.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Heed me, empty vessel. Thine all-too-clumsy effort to draw out that which─by thine own admission─defieth thine understanding is the very height of folly.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Temper thy desire. Trust to the results of thine experiments. And when thou hast witnessed these mortals in the fullness of their glory, then mayest thou determine if the prize thou seekest is thine for the taking...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)Acknowledged. Attempt to artificially elicit potential has failed. Tend to your injuries, Alpha group, and prepare for the next round of testing.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Forename! Alpha! I need your help. It's Nero, he's─

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...'Twould seem we all have a tale to share. But not here. Come on, we're leaving!

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh...

dialogue.name: GARLONDGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: MadamSir! The chief has already departed for Rhalgr's Reach. A few of our people were on hand to help him transport Nero.

dialogue.name: GARLONDGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Oh, and I was told to tell you that Jessie expects a full report as soon as it's convenient. And by that, she generally means “now.”

dialogue.name: GARLONDGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: If you haven't spoken with Jessie yet, it's probably best not to keep her waiting! Not to worry: I'll keep curious travelers from tumbling into the Yawn.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh...?

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Forename! I was told you'd made it out of the hole, but nothing beats seeing you with my own two eyes.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: In case you're wondering, Nero was taken straight to the infirmary. The chief should be back soon with news if you don't mind waiting...

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text:
Chief.
...How is he?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Not good. It seems one of Omega's nastier minions paid him a visit in our absence. He's putting on a brave face, but having seen his injuries, I'm surprised he kept going for as long as he did.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The chirurgeon's confined him to bed. Even should Omega extend its next “invitation,” Nero won't be coming with us.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...Midgardsormr is taking a lengthy nap now, isn't he? And it won't be long before our base camp is lost to the rift again...

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: When the time comes, I'll join the expedition myself. The challenges will only get harder, and you'll need someone reliable at your back.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I appreciate the offer, Jessie. And I may yet take you up on it...when the time comes.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But let's not make any decisions just yet. I have a lot of thinking to do─about what's happened, and about what lies ahead.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh...

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: The poor thing. He seems worried...

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Thank you for trying to save me!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Don't worry─we'll get Omega in the end.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: ...Kweh!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Well that got a smile out of him. We may not understand what he says, but I think we can understand how he feels.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Right! Much as I'd like to stay and chat, we all have work to do. Sooner or later, we're going to have to face Omega itself, and we've all seen what it's capable of.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We need to be stronger. We need to be ready when Omega calls on us again. Let's make sure that we are.

obj.n: In the Beginning, There Was Chaos
